titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Center for Columbia River History records circa 1854-2007
Center for Columbia River History records

repository.corpname: Oregon Historical Society, Davies Family Research Library

did.unittitle: Center for Columbia River History collection

physdesc.extent: 22 document cases and 1 card file box

did.abstract: Research files relating to aspects of the Columbia River Basin, including environmental, social, political, and cultural issues. Files were created by Donna Sinclair and Katrine Barber.
did.langmaterial: Materials in the collection are inEnglish

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Center for Columbia River History was created in 1990. It was a consortium of the Washington State Historical Society, Portland State University, and Washington State University, Vancouver, and offered quality history programs about the Columbia River Basin to the general public. It cooperated with other institutions in the Columbia River area to promote research, develop curriculum, teach special courses, publish materials in electronic and text formats, and present public programs about the Basin. Directors of the Center included Katrine Barber and Donna Sinclair.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists largely of working files of Donna Sinclair, including subject files relating to the Columbia River Basin and its communities. Materials include notes, correspondence, and copies of source materials.

arrangement.p:
Materials are arranged in four series:
Research Files--Umatilla
Research Files--Cottage Grove
Research Files--Columbia Slough
General research files

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to the public.

userestrict.p: The Oregon Historical Society is the owner of the materials in the Research Library and makes available reproductions for research, publication, and other uses. Written permission must be obtained from the Research Library prior to any use of reproductions. The Society does not necessarily hold copyright to all the materials in the collections. In some cases, permission for use of reproductions may require seeking additional authorization from the copyright holders.

prefercite.p: Center for Columbia River History collection, Coll 292, Oregon Historical Society, Davies Family Research Library

separatedmaterial.p: Oral history recordings acquired with this collection have been transferred to the oral history collections of the Oregon Historical Society Research Library.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.

dsc.p: The following section contains a detailed listing of the materials in the collection.
